title: Features & API Reference
description: Complete reference of all available features and code examples from v1.0.0 to latest

content.text: MIS Barangay provides a comprehensive set of features for barangay administration. This guide covers all features that have been available since the initial release and continue to be supported in the latest version.
Below you'll find detailed documentation for each feature with practical code examples.
Complete system for managing resident information including personal details, household links, and status tracking.

content.title: Key Features
content.content:
‚Ä¢ Add new residents with comprehensive personal information
‚Ä¢ Link residents to households
‚Ä¢ Track resident status (active, inactive)
‚Ä¢ Search and filter residents by various criteria
‚Ä¢ View detailed resident profiles
‚Ä¢ Update resident information in real-time
‚Ä¢ Export resident data

content.code:
CREATE TABLE residents (
    id INT(11) UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    household_id INT(11) UNSIGNED NULL,
    first_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    middle_name VARCHAR(100) NULL,
    last_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    suffix VARCHAR(20) NULL,
    birthdate DATE NOT NULL,
    birthplace VARCHAR(150) NULL,
    gender ENUM('Male', 'Female', 'Other'),
    civil_status VARCHAR(50),
    religion VARCHAR(100),
    occupation VARCHAR(150),
    citizenship VARCHAR(100) DEFAULT 'Filipino',
    contact_no VARCHAR(15),
    address VARCHAR(255),
    voter_status ENUM('Yes', 'No') DEFAULT 'No',
    disability_status ENUM('Yes', 'No') DEFAULT 'No',
    remarks TEXT,
    status ENUM('Active', 'Inactive') DEFAULT 'Active',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (household_id) REFERENCES households(id) ON DELETE SET NULL
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4;

content.text: Group residents into households and manage family structures with ease.

content.title: Key Features
content.content:
‚Ä¢ Create and manage household groups
‚Ä¢ Link multiple residents to a household
‚Ä¢ Track household composition
‚Ä¢ View household statistics
‚Ä¢ Household head designation
‚Ä¢ Status tracking (active/inactive)

content.code:
CREATE TABLE households (
    id INT(11) UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    household_head VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    address VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    zone VARCHAR(50),
    purk VARCHAR(50),
    status ENUM('Active', 'Inactive') DEFAULT 'Active',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4;

content.text: Generate, track, and manage barangay certificates including clearance, residency, and indigency certificates.

content.title: Supported Certificates
content.content:
‚Ä¢ **Barangay Clearance** - General good moral character certification
‚Ä¢ **Residency Certificate** - Proof of residence in the barangay
‚Ä¢ **Indigency Certificate** - Certification of financial need
‚Ä¢ **Custom Certificates** - Extensible system for additional types

content.code:
CREATE TABLE certificate_request (
    id INT(11) UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    resident_id INT(11) UNSIGNED NOT NULL,
    certificate_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    purpose TEXT,
    status ENUM('Pending', 'Approved', 'Rejected') DEFAULT 'Pending',
    issued_by INT(11) UNSIGNED,
    requested_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    approved_at TIMESTAMP NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (resident_id) REFERENCES residents(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (issued_by) REFERENCES users(id)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4;

content.text: Certificates can be printed with customizable scaling and margins:
Manage barangay officers including Barangay Captain, Secretary, Treasurer, and other positions with term tracking.

content.title: Key Features
content.content:
‚Ä¢ Add officers with position and term dates
‚Ä¢ Link officers to resident records
‚Ä¢ Track officer status (Active/Inactive)
‚Ä¢ Term period management
‚Ä¢ Only one active Barangay Captain allowed
‚Ä¢ Position-based access control

content.code:
CREATE TABLE officers (
    id INT(11) UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT(11) NULL,
    resident_id INT(11) UNSIGNED NULL,
    position VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    term_start DATE NOT NULL,
    term_end DATE NOT NULL,
    status ENUM('Active', 'Inactive') DEFAULT 'Active',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (resident_id) REFERENCES residents(id) ON DELETE SET NULL
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4;

content.text: Incident reporting and case management system for barangay tanod (security personnel).

content.title: Key Features
content.content:
‚Ä¢ Create incident reports (blotter entries)
‚Ä¢ Track case status (pending, resolved, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Search incidents by date, type, or resident
‚Ä¢ View detailed incident history
‚Ä¢ Tanod-specific access control

content.code:
CREATE TABLE blotter (
    id INT(11) UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    complainant VARCHAR(255),
    respondent VARCHAR(255),
    date_of_incident DATE NOT NULL,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    description TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'Pending',
    remarks TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4;

content.text: Role-based access control system with multiple user types and permission levels.

content.title: User Roles
content.content:
‚Ä¢ **Admin** - Full system access, user management
‚Ä¢ **Staff** - Resident, certificate, and officer management
‚Ä¢ **Tanod** - Blotter system access
‚Ä¢ **Custom Positions** - Staff members with specific roles (Secretary, Treasurer, etc.)

content.code:
CREATE TABLE users (
    id INT(11) UNSIGNED AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    username VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    password VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100),
    role ENUM('Admin', 'Staff', 'Tanod') DEFAULT 'Staff',
    position VARCHAR(150),
    profile_picture VARCHAR(255),
    status ENUM('Active', 'Inactive') DEFAULT 'Active',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4;

content.text: Role-based dashboard showing relevant statistics and metrics.

content.title: Dashboard Metrics
content.content:
‚Ä¢ **Total Residents** - Active and inactive count
‚Ä¢ **Households** - Number of registered households
‚Ä¢ **Certificates Issued** - Certificate statistics by type
‚Ä¢ **Blotter Cases** - Incident reports and status breakdown
‚Ä¢ **Active Officers** - Current officer positions
‚Ä¢ **User Statistics** - System user count by role

content.text: Common utility functions available throughout the system for developers.
System uses a migration framework for database schema evolution. Migrations can be run via browser interface or CLI.

content.title: Available Migrations
content.content:
‚Ä¢ `create_users_table.php` - User authentication
‚Ä¢ `create_residents_table.php` - Resident data
‚Ä¢ `create_households_table.php` - Household grouping
‚Ä¢ `create_officers_table.php` - Officer management
‚Ä¢ `create_blotter_table.php` - Incident reports
‚Ä¢ `create_certificates_request_table.php` - Certificate tracking
‚Ä¢ `merge_staff_officers.php` - Integration of staff and officers
‚Ä¢ `add_indexes.php` - Performance optimization
